name: El Apóstol
summary: El Apóstol (Spanish: "The Apostle") is a 1917 Argentine animated film utilizing cutout animation, and the world's first animated feature film.[1] It was directed and produced respectively by Italian immigrants Quirino Cristiani and Federico Valle.
